messages.subject: entertainment books
messages.msgSnippet: Please pardon the cross-duplication, but I wanted to tell those of you going to conferences (Learnapalooza in Kansas City at the end of May or Live and Learn
messages.messageBody:
Please pardon the cross-duplication, but I wanted to tell those of you going to
conferences (Learnapalooza in Kansas City at the end of May or Live and Learn in
Boston at the end of August) about a possible purchase. Even if you're not going to
conferences, you may be interested in this for other possible vacation spots.

I am IN NO WAY affiliated with the company that produces the Entertainment books
and I stand to gain nothing by this endorsement.

My husband and I purchased Entertainment books (offer a large selection of 2-for-1
discount coupons) for Kansas City and Boston recently. They are normally around
$30-$40. They are currently $9.99, plus $5 for each book for shipping. We plan on
spending some time in KC and Boston after the conferences. I just received them
yesterday and know that we will MORE than make up the $15 price for each, just in
pizza and fast food coupons, let alone museum discounts. The coupons expire on
Nov. 1, 2004.

You can go to www.entertainment.com and look at the coupons each book offers.
You can purchase for other cities there, too. Right now, all of the books for any city
are $9.99.

We plan on using whatever coupons we can while in the cities, then passing the
books on to someone there, or perhaps leave them in the hotel lobby.

Amey Park
